alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:28PM CDT until September 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL FLOYD AND CENTRAL MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 428 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Cee Vee to 5 miles east of Matador to 5 miles north of Dougherty, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Matador. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Blowing dust is occurring along the leading edge of these storms. Expect temporary reductions in visibility from the dust.
